subject: Re: [junit] JUnit4: TestListener questions
msgSnippet: ... My proposed JUnit 4 test runner for Eclipse uses the test object to get its class.  So, I could deal if only the Class was passed, but it s nice to have
messageBody:
Kent Beck wrote:

> 1. The first argument is the test object. I assume that it will be useful,
> if only to print with toString(). I don't have any examples where it is
> used, though, which makes me suspicious.

My proposed JUnit 4 test runner for Eclipse uses the test object to get
its class. So, I could deal if only the Class was passed, but it's nice
to have the Object.

David Saff
